title: [Large-scale] Fundamentals of Robot Navigation Algorithms: Scientific Environment Exploration and Experimental Design Based on Ultrasonic Sensors

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of robotics, introductory programming, understanding sensor operation principles, basic knowledge of scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education focusing on understanding indoor environment mapping and obstacle avoidance algorithms using ultrasonic sensors. Aims to strengthen experimental design and data analysis skills.

learning_goals: Learners explain the scientific principles of grid-based map generation algorithms and simulate simple environments.
Learners implement an experimental process to estimate obstacle locations by analyzing ultrasonic sensor data and validate the measurement data.
Learners can design robotic movement paths in unpredictable environments by applying behavioral learning algorithms and derive conclusions based on observational data.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
